speaker: friend1
line: Omg this cake is insane — here, you have to try it!

speaker: user
line: Actually, I can't. I'm allergic to peanuts, and I think there's peanut butter in that.

speaker: friend2
line: Come on Alex, one bite won't kill you.

speaker: friend3
line: Wait... is it really that serious? You've had this before, right?

speaker: user
line: Yes, it's really serious. Even a tiny bit could send me to the hospital.

speaker: friend1
line: But it's Sarah's birthday cake! Can't you just pick around the peanut parts?

speaker: user
line: It doesn't work like that. Cross-contamination means even touching the same knife could be dangerous for me.

speaker: friend2
line: You're being way too paranoid. My cousin has a nut allergy and she eats stuff like this all the time.

speaker: friend3
line: Yeah, and look — there's barely any nuts visible in this piece.

speaker: user
line: I appreciate that you want me to enjoy the party, but I could literally stop breathing. That's not worth the risk.

speaker: friend1
line: Ugh, fine. But you're missing out on the best part of the party.

speaker: friend2
line: Wait, are you serious about the breathing thing? I thought allergies just made you feel sick.

speaker: user
line: Anaphylaxis can close my throat and drop my blood pressure. I carry an EpiPen for emergencies.

speaker: friend3
line: Oh wow... I had no idea it was that intense. Sorry for pushing.

speaker: friend1
line: Yeah, I'm sorry too. I didn't realize how dangerous it actually is.

speaker: user
line: Thanks for understanding. I can still have fun at the party — just without the cake!

speaker: friend2
line: Hey, there's ice cream in the freezer. Want me to check if any flavors are safe for you?

speaker: friend3
line: And we can totally just hang out and dance. The cake isn't everything.

speaker: user
line: That sounds perfect! Thanks for being such good friends about this.

speaker: friend1
line: Of course! Your safety is way more important than cake. Let's go check out that ice cream!
